English: SHOW SCAVENGING SITES OPTIONS (ON NEW GAME ONLY)
Show additional options for number and type of scavenging sites in game world.
Show additional options for the turn based Tactical part of the game.
Show additional options for the strategic (or Geoscape) part of the game.
Show more options that can only be changed on starting a new game.
SHOW OPTIONS THAT CAN BE CHANGED ANYTIME
Show options that can also be changed any time in the Mod config tab.
Life is hard enough already; games don't have to be.
The pain! The horror! Open the floodgates of despair!
ADDITIONAL OPTIONS ON NEW GAME START

You can choose to get a squad with random identities (as in Vanilla without doing the tutorial), the Vanilla tutorial starting squad (with higher stats), or a squad that will include Sophia Brown and Jacob with unbuffed stats (default on TFTV). Note that Jacob is a sniper, as in the title screen :)
Select your starting base. You can choose a specific location to start from. Please note that some locations are harder to start from than others!

You can choose a different faction background. If you do, one of your Assaults and your starting Heavy on Legend and Hero, Assault on Veteran, or Sniper on Rookie will be replaced by an operative of the elite class of the Faction of your choice. You will also get the corresponding faction technology once the faction researches it.
Total number of scavenging sites generated on game start, not counting overgrown sites. (Vanilla: 16, TFTV default 8, because Ambushes generate additional resources).
Play with game mechanics that set a limit to how many Pandorans you can capture per mission.
Play with game mechanics that make obtaining food or mutagens from captured Pandorans harder.

In Vanilla and default TFTV, resource crate scavenging sites are much more likely to spawn than either vehicle or personnel rescues. You can modify the relative chances of each type of scavenging site being generated. Choose none to have 0 scavenging sites of this type (for reference, high/medium/low ratio is 6/4/1).
You can choose a different difficulty setting for the tactical portion of the game at any time.
If enabled, the first personal skill (level 1) is set right after a character is created (starting soldiers, new recruits in havens, rewards, etc).
Havens under attack will send an SOS, revealing their location to the player.
You can still restart the mission though.
The starting type of passenger module, FAR-M, will slowly recuperate the stamina of the operatives on board. Switch off if you prefer to have to return to base more often.
Reveal exfiltration location on the second turn of the mission, making it considerably easier.
Phoenix Units suffer 25% extra damage AND all enemies have 25% damage resistance.
Ambushes will happen more often and will be harder. Regardless of this setting, all ambushes will have crates in them. Set to false on Rookie by default

The stamina of any operative that sustains an injury in combat that results in a disabled body part will be set to zero after the mission. The stamina of any operative that undergoes a mutation or bionic augmentation will also be set to zero.

Diplomatic penalties from choices in events are doubled and revealing diplomatic missions for one faction gives a diplomatic penalty with the other factions. Can be applied to a game in progress. Set to false on Rookie by default

In TFTV, Ancient Weapons are replaced by the Impossible Weapons (IW) counterparts. They have different functionality (read: they are nerfed) and some of them require additional faction research. Check this option off to keep Impossible Weapons with the same stats and functionality as Ancient Weapons in Vanilla and without requiring additional faction research. Set to false by default on Rookie.

TFTV adjusts the amount of resources gained in Missions and Events by difficulty level. Please be aware that, for Events, TFTV 100% refers to Vanilla Pre-Azazoth patch levels (so it's actually 80% of current Vanilla amount).

Choose the amount of Exotic Resources you want to have in your game per playthrough. Each unit provides enough resources to manufacture one set of Impossible Weapons. So, if you want to have two full sets, set this number to 2, and so on. By default, this is set by the difficulty level: 2.5 on Rookie, 2 on Veteran, 1.5 on Hero, 1 on Legend.
Choose whether to skip Logos on game launch, Intro and Landing cinematics. Adapted from Mad's Assorted Adjustments.
If you are playing on a Low-end system and experience lag with this Void Omen, you can turn it off here. This will prevent it from rolling.
PLAY WITH MORE MIST VOID OMEN
Applies the changes from Dtony BetterEnemies that make Pandorans more of a challenge.
The characters will continue to animate during shooting sequences and targets that are hit may flinch, causing subsequent shots in a burst to miss when shooting in freeaim mode.
Enemy reinforcements do not drop items on death; disallows farming for weapons on missions with infinite reinforcements.
After a raid, all faction havens are immediately set to highest alert and may not be raided in the next 7 days.
Trade is always 1 tech for 5 food or 5 materials, so no profit can be made from trading.

Saving and loading on Tactical can result in odd behavior and bugs (Vanilla issues). It is recommended to save only on Geoscape (and use several saves, in case one of them gets corrupted). And, you know what... losing soldiers in TFTV is fun :)
has already been implemetend on starting or a loading a game! PLEASE QUIT TO DESKTOP BEFORE STARTING OR LOADING A GAME
If you fail a story mission, that is it; you may not retry it again. On by default on ETERMES.
PLAY WITH LIMITED DEPLOYMENT VOID OMEN

If you are finding the VOID OMEN reducing Maximum Deployment by 2 (and increasing soldier XP by 100%) unfun, you can turn it off here. This will prevent it from rolling and, if already rolled, will prevent it from having any effect.

Disables or enables the vanilla behavior of automatically putting an actor into standby mode and thus switching to the next actor when all AP are used. ATTENTION: This function is WIP, i.e. currently still experimental!
Shows when any error ocurrs. Please, do not change unless you know what you are doing.
Your operatives will silently execute your commands and stoically bear with their consequences.
